Food, Nutrition,&Health
Eat Smart
Watch these podcasts to discover how to become healthier for yourself and your family!
Whole Grains For Your Whole Family Watch to figure out what to look for when choosing whole grain bread. Stretch Your Dollar, Switch to Water Find out how to save money by changing what your drink. Reducing Your Child's Sodium Intake Watch for tips on reducing sodium in your children's diet. Enjoy Your Food But Eat Less Tips for keeping you and your family fuller for longer. Kid Tested and Approved Discover fun ways to include fruits and vegetables in your children's meals that they will enjoy! Food Safety Saves Lives Learn ways to keep your family safe from food related sickness. Increasing Your Physical Activity Discover easy ways to have more energy by simply moving more. Be Active Your Way Watch for ideas on getting your whole family to be active. Community Foods: Local Access to Affordable and Nutritious Food Have you ever wondered what happens at the farmer's markets? Watch for more information. How Can I Use My EBT Card at the Farmers' Market? Discover how easy it is to use your EBT card at the farmer's market. Shopping on a Budget Watch for ideas on how to get the most for your food dollars at the grocery store. You Are What You Eat: Lessons in Labeling Learn what to look for on a nutrition label. Make Healthier Choices While Eating Fast Food Learn what to order when eating at a fast food restaurant. Moving More, Everyday,&Everywhere Watch for tips on how to include physical activity and exercise in your routine. Keeping Your Food and Family Safe Learn how to take food from the grocery store to the kitchen table safely. Healthy Hydration Learn what water does for you and how to get more throughout the day. Drink For Your Health If you're tired of drinking just plain water, watch this video for ideas on other healthy drink choices. Mom: The Decision Maker Watch for tips on how to eat meals as a family and how to connect with your children better. The Color of Health Learn how to get more servings each day. Planning Healthy Meals at Home Meal planning can take some stress out of your evening routine, watch for tips on how to get started. Washing Produce Learn how to properly wash fresh fruits and vegetables before serving them as part of a meal.
Based on North Carolina EFNEP, Families Eating Smart, Moving More
These podcasts were created and produced by students in Human Nutrition, Foods, and Exercise's Communicating with Food course. Technological support provided by Virginia Tech's Innovation Space.
This publication was funded by USDA's Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program provides nutrition assistance to people with low incomes. It can help you buy nutritious foods for a better diet. To find out more, contact your local county or city Department of Social Services (phone listed under city/county government). For help in finding local number, call toll-free: 1-800-552-3431 (M-F 8:15-5:00, except holidays). By calling your local DSS office, you can get other useful information about services.
